data.title: Great burger
data.text: We went here for lunch.  The burger was one of the best I have ever eaten.  The pizza, not so good, the crust was wet. The chicken sandwhich was good but not great.  Great ambiance.

data.title: Dinner Wowza
data.text: We were tired and stopped and on a friends recommendation. And I have to say it was beyond expectations. The lamb shepherds pie was very tasty but the burgers excelled. In the mood for a burger that's above the pale stop here. It's a little noisy ad the alcohol 🍺 gets flowin. It is a pub after all!

data.title: Wonderful,restaurant and dog friendly
data.text: Three of us had a fantastic evening at this quaint, little, restaurant in the middle of historic Roswell.  My husband and I are from Florida, and were visiting an old friend here in the Atlanta area.  She suggested we go to the Salt Factory, as they welcome dogs to their outdoor seating area, and they even gave her dog a bowl of water.  We enjoyed the food, and the service was outstanding.  I would highly recommend this fun, cozy, restaurant.

data.title: Small spot, big character
data.text:
Five of us took dinner based upon reviews and ratings and we were not disappointed. :-)  
Four of us had burgers, including one vegetarian quinoa burger, and we were all very pleased. The chow-chow on the Roswell burger was not spicy at all, as one of our group was concerned, and added a subtle flavor to my burger reminiscent of sweet relish. French fries seemed to be the fresh cut style, really crispy but not overdone, cooked just right and really tasty. 
The 5th person had the twin filet. She so enjoyed the fresh taste of the spinach, a small portion served more as a garnish, that she requested more as a side dish, and was promptly accommodated. 
Very accommodating service to our several special requests.  The atmosphere/decor inside (we were seated outside) seemed to have a lot of character and made me think there was a significant number of repeat customers. 

A very enjoyable evening and I would definitely become one of those repeat customers.

data.title: Love the Salt in Salt!
data.text: Salt is this relaxing place and their menu is varied for all type of palates. My fav is their poached pear salad ( enough for two to share) is delish. I also like their Pizza called " The White".  But my friends seem to enjoy their dishes too so truly u won't go bad with whatever u order.  They have several locations.  I tend to go to Roswell locale but also have gone to their Alpharetta location.  Check them out! Holly in Alpharetta and Jess in Roswell are great.

data.title: Mussels!!
data.text:
I love their mussels. Love love love them.  Good wine selection also. 

But the mussels.   Just wow.  Service and location very good also.

data.title: Good restaurant in a competitive market.
data.text:
You have to be good to survive in a place so rife with good eating establishments.  The Satl factory is still around because it has good atmosphere, excellent food and wonderful wait staff.

I did the burgers and it is wonderful meat and they can cook it like you want it.  Loved tasting those wonderful beef juices.  The wife went light and had the she-crab soup.  She said it was excellent and we used to live near the Chesapeake Bay so she knows good she-crab.

Desserts were wonderful, as was the coffee.  Just an all around enjoyable time.  I have been before and will be here again the next time I am in town.

data.title: Will be back
data.text: I'm trying to get more aquatinted with the Roswell and Alpharetta area. We loved this place. Great menu, beautiful bar, interesting staff. The Saturday night crowd was lively and we had a 40 minute wait at 7pm. Not bad. Great for date night. Can't wait to return.

data.title: Great Spot in Roswell
data.text: This was the second time I have dined at Salt Factory.  Both times by myself and sat at bar. First time had the mussels and they were great. Last time I tried the London broil and it was very good too.  Service was friendly and efficient.  I will return.  A good choice if you are in the Roswell area.

data.title: Best on Canton Street
data.text: Dine here 1-2 times per month. If you come down for alive after five the third Thursday of each month come EARLY like by 4:30 or be prepared to wait.

data.title: The Best Burger Ever
data.text: What a great little place, in the cutest little town!  The food was so good, too!  We had burgers and they were honestly the best burgers we've ever had.  We enjoyed sitting outside and people watching, and April, our server, was so attentive, even though the place was packed.  Everything was terrific, and would highly recommend this place.

data.title: Good food in Roswell restaurant
data.text: I have eaten here a few times now because I love going to the downtown Roswell area. It is a small restaurant but they seat a good amount of people, especially with their outdoor seating. I had a white pizza that hit the spot, and my friend ordered the margaret pizza, which had delicious tomatoes! I recommend this restaurant if you are in the area- but if it is too busy, a couple of the ones just next door are just as delicious!

data.title: Lunch with Friends
data.text: I love this restaurant, both this one and the one on Highway 9 in downtown Alpharetta.  I always enjoy a nice lunch here on weekdays and dropping by for an after-work drink on Fridays or Saturdays.  Never disappoints.

data.title: Out of The Way
data.text: What a great little treasure just outside of Atlanta, GA! Great food, service beyond compare and great SOuthern Charm.

data.title: Loud but ok food
data.text: Received recommendation for this place. Went for lunch, place was very loud. Had the tacos but shell was way too crunchy to enjoy as a handheld.

data.title: Great Mussles dish, osso bucco needs some help
data.text: Greta stop over for a lunch or dinner on Canton. Recommended. Enjoy the mussels dish as an appetizer. No disappointment there yet.

data.title: Average food
data.text: I like this place for location and they have a decent bar selection, but each time, this one included, the food is meh. For some flavorless egg rolls and a pizza to share that was downright soggy. Just not good for what they could be doing. I'll go elsewhere unless it's just for a drink.

data.title: Just so so in the suburbs
data.text: I've had several items at this restaurant for lunch.  I can't say that I've had anything that I would qualify as good except for maybe the french fries. The food is priced as if it is fresh, high quality ingredients.   However,  it is fairly institutional.   The wait staff is fantastic.   I've had the same waiter the past two times I've eaten here and he made it a pleasant experience.   Fairly good lunch option for Roswell if you are already in the area.

data.title: Decent food but pricey
data.text: Lunch for 3 with drinks was $100.  Food was ok, service was good.  Not sure I'd go back, too many other choices around.

data.title: Great Place to Eat!
data.text: Weather was nice, the food was delicious, and all the staff (Holly) was awesome!!! Had drinks and eats with friends for a birthday get together.
